desc: Explore the breathtaking beauty of majestic landscapes around the world.

sttData.content: The Grand Canyon is a steep-sided canyon carved by the Colorado River in Arizona, United States. It is one of the most famous natural wonders in the world.
The Northern Lights, also known as the Aurora Borealis, is a natural light display in the polar regions. It is a result of the interaction between solar particles and Earth's magnetic field.
The Great Barrier Reef is the largest coral reef system in the world, stretching over 2,300 kilometers (1,430 miles) along the northeastern coast of Australia.
The Sahara Desert is the largest hot desert in the world, covering an area of about 9 million square kilometers (3.5 million square miles) across North Africa.

The Swiss Alps are a major mountain range in Europe, renowned for their stunning scenery and challenging ski runs. They stretch over 150 kilometers (93 miles) along the border of Switzerland, Italy, Austria, and France.

stt.sttSummary: Explore the beauty of the Grand Canyon, Northern Lights, Great Barrier Reef, Sahara Desert, and Swiss Alps in this audio.
